steps.title: â€œTen toes downâ€ stems from African American Vernacular English (AAVE).
steps.content: â€œTen toes downâ€ stems from African American Vernacular English (AAVE). While the exact origin of â€œten toes downâ€ is unclear, it gained mainstream popularity in the 2010s, mainly due to its use in rap and hip-hop songs. Artists like Chief Keef, Nipsey Hussle, Lil Durk, and Nav featured the phrase in their music, reinforcing its meaning of loyalty, resilience, and staying grounded. People began using the phrase on social media and in everyday conversation during this time, which helped increase its popularity.
